page.lettertext:
fol.47r
31 May
Right honorable & my singular good Lorde, my duty first
re-
membred in most humble maner. It maye stande w
t
yo
r
L.
good favo
r
to be advertised, that these affaires of her
Ma
tie
whic
h
I am heere to solicite, were in forward state to spede well, if
the
Duke of Brunswicke
alone had the maneging of matte
rs.
For he promiseth as muche as her Ma
tie
doth require: but I
see the
Elector of Saxonie
, hath a negative voice in all thing
s
that the rest w
t
out him, will take no enterprise in hand, &
he w
t
out the Empero
r
, whome he feareth but too muche, will
hardly be persuaded to
take
any thing of moment. The D.
of Brunsw
.
hath sent him her Ma
ties
letters, & w
t
all he him
self hath written to good purpose: as yo
r
L. maye perceave
by the copie of his letter, whiche I have sent to
m
r
Secretar
y
And if that be weakely written, he will urge him in an other
w
t
more forceable reasons. Wherof & of all this action, a bette
r
successe might happely ensewe, as the D. himself hath often sa
id
if it were not so late before we sette forwarde. I can
not knowe in this countrey, what forces have bin levied for the
Guise
or any other: but I sent a note to M
r
Secretary of 780
0
horsemen, whiche were most out of
Saxonie
, & all for the Guis
e
as is thought in these quarters, albeit the report was give
n
out, that they were for her Ma
tie
. They talke in some place
s
of a great many more, but I thinke of those
e most part ar
e
past
e Rhine a great while since. The D. of Brunswic
ke
hath caused many to be staied, and likewise
e
Electo
r
of Br
an
deburgh
&
e
Lantg
.
of Hesse
. In the D. of Brunswicke
s
court I was very honorabley intertened: but there was litle
to
be learned of the affaires of other places: for other court
iers
then those of his councel, & his ordinarie servaunts there were
none to conferre w
t
all: & of them the most part, knowe so
litle as is wonderfull. I am nowe come to
Lubecke
and ex-
pect but a winde toe carie me for
Denmarke
: from whence I turne
againe for Brunswicke, to receave some answear from
e Electors
&
e Lantgrave of Hesse. Of my whole proceeding in this ca
use
because I have written all at large to M
r
Secretary, I
will
not ...
yo
r
L. with a tedious repetition. About Mi
...
fol.47v
shall marie
e
second daughter
of the Duke of Saxonie. It is t
hought
the
Kinge of Denmarke
, and the chiefest
Princ es of Germany
will
mete together at
e mariage. Perhaps yo
r
L. hath for
got
that yow mentioned unto me certaine
of
gammons bacon: but
yet I am not come, where the best are to be had: but there I
pur
pose to be homewardes, and to yelde yo
r
L. humble thank
s
if they maye be accepted, as I doe continually w
t
all hum
ble
duty for her Ma
ties
service, w
c
I obtened by yo
r
L. besechi
ng
God most instantly, to increase yo
r
happines in hono
r
to y
o
r
L. owne desire, & greatest contentation.
Lube
ck
1585. Maye 31. Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden. Tho. Bodley.
